items.title: Drop-in custom physics replication solution for Roblox!
items.text:
Chrono provides full control over replication and physics while remaining compatible with Roblox‚Äôs networking model. It is designed to be drop-in for existing games, with a wide range of configurations allowing for custom characters and more.

If you like Chrono, consider starring the repo‚≠ê!

items.title: 1. Fixed replication rate
items.text:
Roblox replication is capped at 20 Hz.

Chrono uses a dynamic tick rate instead. Tick rate scales from "default" -> "half" -> "not replicated" based on user provided distances!

items.title: 2. Forced interpolation delay
items.text:
When someone moves, it takes x ms to reach the server and then another x ms to reach another client and then another 200-500ms (or something around that, we're not too sure) to interpolate.

Chrono lets the DEVELOPER, control the minimum and maximum delay (or u can use a static delay!). You can introspect it in realtime so lag compensation becomes much nicer :3

items.title: 3. No usable historical state
items.text: Roblox doesn‚Äôt store ur snapshots. Chrono does (and has lagcomp api using serverclock).

items.title: 4. Unoptimized af
items.text:
For 150 NPCs moving randomly:

  • roblox used 110.29 kb/s send and 412 kb/s receive.
  • chrono used 3.72 kb/s send and 42.97 kb/s receive

items.title: Configurations
items.text: Most people are done from just starting chrono. But Chrono offers a wide range of configurations.

items.title: Applying your configurations
items.text:
First, we will go over how to apply your configurations.

To override Chrono's default configurations create a shared module script that requires the config module and use SetConfig, RegisterEntityType, and RegisterEntityModel before starting Chrono.

Example: 

-- Shared/ChronoConfig.lua
local Config = require(PATH_TO_CHRONO.Shared.Config)

Config.SetConfig("DEFAULT_NORMAL_TICK_DISTANCE", 100)
Config.SetConfig("DEFAULT_HALF_TICK_DISTANCE", 200)
Config.SetConfig("REPLICATE_DEATHS", "PLAYER_CHARACTERS")

Config.RegisterEntityType("FAST_ENTITY", {
    TICK_RATE = 1 / 60,
    FULL_ROTATION = true,
})

Config.RegisterEntityType("SLOW_ENTITY", {
    TICK_RATE = 1 / 20,
    FULL_ROTATION = true,
})

Config.RegisterEntityModel("NPC", PATH_TO_NPC_MODEL)
Config.RegisterEntityModel("NPC_WITH_CULL", PATH_TO_NPC_MODEL,Vector3.new(4,4,4))

return nil

Then, in the main script, you can either pass the module or require the module beforehand manually. 

--MAIN SCRIPT

local chrono = require(PATH_TO_CHRONO)
chrono.Start(Shared.ChronoConfig)

items.title: Configurations
items.text:
These are Chrono's default values. If you don't override them, these are the settings chrono will run with. 

local BASE_CONFIG = {
    __VERSION = "v2.0.0",
    CHECK_NEW_VERSION = true,

    MIN_BUFFER = 0.09,
    MAX_BUFFER = 0.5,
    QUERY_RADIUS = 100,

    DEFAULT_NORMAL_TICK_DISTANCE = 50,
    DEFAULT_HALF_TICK_DISTANCE = 100, -- Beyond this distance, entities stop replicating

    PLAYER_REPLICATION = "AUTOMATIC",

    REPLICATE_DEATHS = "PLAYER_ENTITIES",
    REPLICATE_CFRAME_SETTERS = "PLAYER_ENTITIES",

    DEFAULT_MODEL_REPLICATION_MODE = "NATIVE",

    SEND_FULL_ROTATION = false,
    SHOW_WARNINGS = false,
    MAX_SNAPSHOT_COUNT = 30,
}
We will walk through each of them here one by one.

items.title: Buffering
items.text:
MIN_BUFFER / MAX_BUFFER controls interpolation buffer limits.

In snapshot interpolation, instead of rendering the newest snapshot immediately, we render the world slightly in the past for smooth interpolation between many snapshots.

Interpolation delay should be large enough that you can lose ~2 packets in a row and still interpolate forward.

This leads to the widely used heuristic: Interpolation buffer = 2-3x snapshot interval (1/sendRate)

Snapshot Rate Snapshot Interval Minimum Buffer 10 Hz 100 ms 200 ms 20 Hz 50 ms 100 ms 30 Hz 33 ms 66 ms 60 Hz 16.7 ms 33 ms

Chrono uses a dynamic interpolation so that it can maintain the smallest buffer thats still safe

MAX_BUFFER is the hard cap on the interpolation delay. It is recommended to be 2-3x MIN_BUFFER so that your interpolation buffer doesn't suddenly jump to like 10000ms

items.title: Distance-Based Replication
items.text:
• DEFAULT_NORMAL_TICK_DISTANCE defines the distance where entities are replicated at the full rate
  • DEFAULT_HALF_TICK_DISTANCE defines the distance where entities replicate at half the rate. Beyond this distance, entities stop replicating entirely.

Distance < DEFAULT_NORMAL_TICK_DISTANCE : Full Tick Rate

DEFAULT_NORMAL_TICK_DISTANCE < Distance < DEFAULT_HALF_TICK_DISTANCE : Half Tick Rate

Distance > DEFAULT_HALF_TICK_DISTANCE : No Replication

VIDEO: TBD

items.title: Player Replication
items.text:
PLAYER_REPLICATION = "AUTOMATIC"
  • AUTOMATIC means that player characters are automatically registered as entities. This was the default for v1 but we figured we should give users the ability to choose whether to use Chrono for players.
  • CUSTOM means that you manually manage player entities.

Warning

If you choose AUTOMATIC Then make sure you have a PLAYER entity type defined.

items.title: Death & CFrame Replication
items.text:
• REPLICATE_DEATHS controls whether Chrono replicates player deaths to the Server and other clients. This is useful for as death replication bugs out when the model is locked or with custom models.

    • NONE - No death replication
    • PLAYER_ENTITIES - Replicates deaths of player-registered entities (default)
    • PLAYER_CHARACTERS - Replicates deaths of player characters

  • REPLICATE_CFRAME_SETTERS controls whether Chrono replicated when PrimaryPart.CFrame changes are made on the server for client-registered entities.

    • NONE - No CFrame setter replication
    • PLAYER_ENTITIES - Replicates CFrame setters of player-registered entities (default)
    • PLAYER_CHARACTERS - Replicates CFrame setters of player characters

items.title: Model Replication Modes
items.text:
• NATIVE - Chrono replicates the model along with using Roblox's native model replication. This is good for cases where you want more responsive replication and don't mind the extra bandwidth.
  • NATIVE_WITH_LOCK - Chrono replicates the model along with using Roblox's native model replication, but locks the model to disable Roblox's native replication and physics. This is good for client-owned models where server doesn't need to simulate physics. Calls LockNativeServerCFrameReplication internally.
  • CUSTOM - Chrono creates a server and client model separately and only replicates CFrames. This is good for low-bandwidth but requires more manual setup.

items.title: Entity Types
items.text:
Chrono lets you define entity archetypes that control how they replicate.

Example: 

local ENTITY_TYPES = {
    DEFAULT = {
        NAME = "DEFAULT",
        TICK_RATE = 1 / 30,
        BUFFER = 0.1,
    },

    WITH_ROT = {
        NAME = "WITH_ROT",
        TICK_RATE = 1 / 2,
        BUFFER = 0.1,
        FULL_ROTATION = true,
    },

    PLAYER = {
        NAME = "PLAYER",
        MODEL_REPLICATION_MODE = "NATIVE_WITH_LOCK",
        BUFFER = 0, -- dynamically handled
        TICK_RATE = 1 / 20,
    },
}

  • BUFFER - The buffer time for the npc

  • TICK_RATE - How often the entity replicates per second.

  • FULL_ROTATION - Whether to replicate full rotation or just yaw. Default is false (yaw only).
  • MODEL_REPLICATION_MODE - Overrides the default model replication mode for this entity type.
  • AUTO_UPDATE_POSITION - This determines if Chrono will automatically call Entity.Push when the entity model moves. Default is true.
  • STORE_SNAPSHOTS - Whether to store snapshots for this entity on the server side. Default is false. Client-owned entities will ignore this and always store snapshots.
  • NORMAL_TICK_DISTANCE - Overrides the default normal tick distance for this entity type.
  • HALF_TICK_DISTANCE - Overrides the default half tick distance for this entity type.
  • CUSTOM_INTERPOLATION - Whether to use custom interpolation for this entity. Default is false. If is true then chrono will not interpolate the entity automatically on the client.

Warning

NAME field is required if modifying the config table directly. But when using RegisterEntityType, the name is taken from the first argument.

items.title: Entity Models
items.text:
Entity models define reuseable models with specific replication settings. When MODEL_REPLICATION_MODE is set to CUSTOM, then only the name of the model string is replicated and the client/server create their own copies of the model, Meaning on the server the model could be a part or not even exist physically, but still shows up on the client.

  • RegisterEntityModel(name: string, model: Model|BasePart, broadphase: Vector3?) - Registers an entity model with the given name, model, and optional broadphase.
    • name - The unique name for the entity model.
    • model - The model or base part to use for this entity.
    • broadphase - Optional Vector3 defining the broadphase hitbox size for culling. Culled entities will not be moved on the client. If the vector is zero then only a point check is done. Otherwise a box check is done. If not provided, no culling is done. This can also be updated later using Entity.SetBroadPhase.

Info

Entity models can be registered after Chrono.Start is called. Meaning you can dynamically add new entity models during runtime.

items.title: Installation
items.text:
For Rojo users: In your wally.toml, add the following line to your dependencies. 

chrono = "parihsz/chrono@2.0.0"
For Studio users: Download the latest rbxl file from Github Releases

items.title: Start Chrono!
items.text:
Chrono runs on top of roblox's replication by default, and can optionally take full control. This makes it easy to drop in without breaking your existing character setup/hitbox logic. Most people just wan't faster replication with minimal overhead!

Starting chrono will automatically set your players up to use chrono's replication and snapshot interpolation üíñ 

--Client
local ReplicatedStorage = game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage")
require(ReplicatedStorage.Packages.chrono).Start()

--Server
local ReplicatedStorage = game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage")
require(ReplicatedStorage.Packages.chrono).Start()

items.title: Properties
items.text:
• broadPhase : Vector3? - The broadphase size of the entity used for culling.

  • autoUpdatePosition : boolean? - Whether Chrono will automatically call Entity.Push when the entity model moves. Default is true.

  • isContextOwner : boolean - Whether this entity is owned by the current context (server or client).

  • networkOwner : Player? - The player who owns this entity on the server. Nil if unowned or on client.

  • snapshot : Snapshot? - Snapshot data for the entity.

  • latestCFrame : CFrame? - The latest CFrame of the entity.

  • latestTime : number? - The latest timestamp of the entity.

  • id : number - The unique ID of the entity. Will be -1 if not registered.

  • entityConfig : EntityType - The configuration table for this entity.

  • modelString : string? - The model string name for this entity if present.

  • model : Model|BasePart? - The model or base part of this entity.

  • paused : boolean - Whether this entity is paused.

  • modelReplicationMode : "NATIVE" | "CUSTOM"?" - The model replication mode for this entity.

  • registered : boolean - Whether this entity is registered in holder.

  • mountParentId : number? - The ID of the parent entity this entity is mounted to, if any.

  • mountOffset : CFrame? - The offset CFrame of this entity when mounted to a parent entity.

Info

For setting properties use the appropriate methods like Entity.SetBroadPhase, Entity.SetAutoUpdatePosition, etc. Goes the same for getting properties.

items.title: new(entityConfig: string?, model: Model | BasePart | string?, modelReplicationMode: MODEL_REPLICATION_MODE?, initCFrame: CFrame?) -> Entity
items.text:
Creates a new Entity instance and automatically registers it.

  • entityConfig - The entity type name to use for this entity. If nil, uses "DEFAULT".
  • model - The model or base part to use for this entity, or the model string name if using custom replication.
  • modelReplicationMode - The model replication mode to use for this entity. If nil, uses the default from config or entity type.
  • initCFrame - The initial CFrame to set for this entity. If nil, uses the model's current CFrame.

items.title: SetModel(self: Entity, model: Model | BasePart | string?, modelReplicationMode: MODEL_REPLICATION_MODE?, noDestroy: boolean?) -> ()
items.text:
Sets the model or base part for this entity. If using custom replication, can also provide a model string name. If model is nil, unsets the model.

  • model - The model or base part to set for this entity, or the model string name if using custom replication.
  • modelReplicationMode - The model replication mode to use for this entity. If nil, uses the default from config or entity type.
  • noDestroy - If true, does not destroy the previous model when changing. Only applies to SERVER context.

items.title: GetModel(self: Entity) -> Model | BasePart?
items.text: Gets the model or base part of this entity. Returns nil if not set.

items.title: SetConfig(self: Entity, entityConfig: string) -> ()
items.text:
Sets the entity type configuration for this entity.

  • entityConfig - The entity type name to use for this entity.

items.title: SetBroadPhase(self: Entity, broadPhase: Vector3?) -> ()
items.text:
Sets the broadphase size for this entity used for culling. If nil, unsets broad

  • broadPhase - The broadphase size to set for this entity.

items.title: GetData(self: Entity) -> any
items.text: Gets the custom data table for this entity. Can be used to store arbitrary data.

items.title: SetData(self: Entity, data: any) -> ()
items.text: Sets the custom data table for this entity. Can be used to store arbitrary data which gets replicated to clients.

items.title: SetMount(self: Entity, parentEntity: Entity, offset: CFrame?) -> ()
items.text:
Sets the mount parent of this entity to another entity, with an optional offset CFrame.

  • parentEntity - The entity to mount this entity to.
  • offset - The offset CFrame of this entity when mounted to the parent entity.

items.title: ClearMount(self: Entity) -> ()
items.text: Clears the mount parent of this entity, if any.

items.title: SetNetworkOwner(self: Entity, player: Player?) -> ()
items.text: Sets the network owner of this entity on the server. If nil, unsets ownership.

items.title: Clear(self: Entity) -> ()
items.text: Clears snapshot data and resets last cached cframe and time.

items.title: PauseReplication(self: Entity) -> ()
items.text: Pauses replication for this entity.

items.title: ResumeReplication(self: Entity) -> ()
items.text: Resumes replication for this entity.

items.title: Push(self: Entity, time: number, value: CFrame) -> boolean
items.text:
Pushes a new snapshot value for this entity at the given time. Returns true if it is the latest snapshot.

  • time - The timestamp of the snapshot.
  • value - The CFrame value of the snapshot.

items.title: GetAtTime(self: Entity, time: number) -> CFrame?
items.text:
Gets the interpolated CFrame of this entity at the given time. Returns nil if no data

  • time - The timestamp to get the interpolated CFrame for.

items.title: GetTargetRenderTime(self: Entity) -> number
items.text: Gets the target render time for this entity based on buffer settings. Returns 0 if no buffering.

items.title: SetAutoUpdatePosition(self: Entity, autoUpdate: boolean) -> ()
items.text: Sets whether Chrono will automatically call Entity.Push when the entity model moves.

items.title: GetCFrame(self: Entity) -> CFrame?
items.text: Gets the latest CFrame of this entity. Will first check self.latestCFrame then fall back to the model's PrimaryPart CFrame if available.

items.title: SetCFrame(self: Entity, cframe: CFrame) -> ()
items.text: This will move the entity instead of interpolating it.

items.title: GetPrimaryPart(self: Entity) -> BasePart?
items.text: Gets the PrimaryPart of the entity's model, if available.

items.title: LockNativeServerCFrameReplication(self: Entity) -> ()
items.text: Locks the native server CFrame replication for this entity's model. Only applies to SERVER context and NATIVE model replication mode.

items.title: UnlockNativeServerCFrameReplication(self: Entity) -> ()
items.text: Unlocks the native server CFrame replication for this entity's model. Only applies to SERVER context and NATIVE model replication mode.

items.title: Destroy(self: Entity) -> ()
items.text: Destroys this entity and unregisters it from the holder. Cleans up model and snapshot data

items.title: GetEvent(self: Entity, eventName: string) -> Event?
items.text: Gets a custom event for this entity by name.

items.title: Events
items.text: These events can be accessed via Entity.GetEvent(self,eventName).

items.title: Destroying
items.text: Fired when the entity is being destroyed.

items.title: NetworkOwnerChanged
items.text:
Fired when the network owner of the entity changes. Provides the new Player or nil.

  • newOwner : Player? - The new network owner player or nil.
  • prevOwner : Player? - The previous network owner player or nil.

items.title: PushedSnapShot
items.text:
Fired when a new snapshot is pushed to the entity.

  • time : number - The timestamp of the pushed snapshot.
  • value : CFrame - The CFrame value of the pushed snapshot.
  • isLatest : boolean - Whether this snapshot is the latest one.

items.title: TickChanged
items.text:
Fired when the tick rate of the entity changes.

  • newTickType : string - The new tick type name.
  • NONE - No ticking
  • NORMAL - Normal tick rate
  • HALF - Half tick rate

items.title: DataChanged
items.text:
Fired when the custom data of the entity changes.

  • newData : any - The new custom data.

items.title: Ticked
items.text:
Fired when the entity is ticked.

  • deltaTime : number - The delta time since last tick.

items.title: ModelChanged
items.text:
Fired when the model of the entity changes.

  • newModel : Model | BasePart? - The new model or base part of the entity.
  • oldModel : Model | BasePart? - The previous model or base part of the entity.

items.title: LockChanged
items.text:
Fired when the native server CFrame replication lock state changes.

  • isLocked : boolean - Whether the native server CFrame replication is locked.

items.title: Shared.Events
items.text: Holds shared event definitions for Chrono.

items.title: EntityAdded
items.text:
Fired when an entity is added to the holder.

  • entity - The entity that was added.

items.title: EntityRemoved
items.text: Fired when an entity is removed from the holder. - entity - The entity that was removed.

items.title: PlayerCharacterRegistered
items.text: Fired when a player character entity is registered. - player - The player whose character was registered. - entity - The entity that was registered as the player's character.

items.title: PlayerCharacterUnregistered
items.text: Fired when a player character entity is unregistered. - player - The player whose character was unregistered. - entity - The entity that was unregistered as the player's character.

items.title: PlayerOwnedAdded
items.text: Fired when a player-owned entity is added. - player - The player who owns the entity. - entity - The entity that was added as player-owned.

items.title: PlayerOwnedRemoved
items.text: Fired when a player-owned entity is removed. - player - The player who owned the entity. - entity - The entity that was removed as player-owned.

items.title: Share.Holder
items.text: A registry that holds entities.

items.title: idMap : {[number]: Entity}
items.text: A map of entity IDs to entity objects.

items.title: SetAsCharacter(player: Player, entity: Entity) -> ()
items.text:
Sets the given entity as the main character for the player.

  • player - The player whose character entity to set.
  • entity - The entity to set as the player's character.

items.title: RemovePlayerCharacter(entity: Entity) -> ()
items.text:
Removes the given entity as a player character, if it is one.

  • entity - The entity to remove as a player character.

items.title: RegisterEntity(entity: Entity) -> ()
items.text: Registers the given entity in the holder.

items.title: UnregisterEntity(entity: Entity) -> ()
items.text: Unregisters the given entity from the holder.

items.title: GetEntityFromId(id: number) -> Entity?
items.text: Gets the entity with the given ID, or nil if not found.

items.title: GetEntityFromModel(model: Model | BasePart) -> Entity?
items.text: Gets the entity associated with the given model or base part, or nil if not found. This is an o(n) operation.

items.title: GetEntityFromPlayer(player: Player) -> Entity?
items.text: Gets the entity associated with the given player character, or nil if not found.

items.title: Server.Receiver
items.text: Handles receiving entity updates from clients on the server.

items.title: RegisterMiddleMan(name: string, priority: number, callback: function) -> ()
items.text:
Registers a middleman function that processes incoming entity updates before they are applied.

  • name - The name of the middleman.
  • priority - The priority of the middleman. higher priority runs first.
  • callback - The function to call for processing. It should take parameters (player: Player, entity: Entity, cframe: CFrame, time: number) -> boolean. Return true to block the update, else allow it.

items.title: UnregisterMiddleMan(name: string) -> ()
items.text: Unregisters a previously registered middleman function.

items.title: Shared.ReplicationRules
items.text: Defines replication rules for entity replication in Chrono.

items.title: SetReplicationRule(target: Player | Model | number | Types.Entity, rule: ReplicationRule | RuleFn | nil) -> ()
items.text:
Sets a replication rule for a specific target.

  • target - The target to set the replication rule for. Can be a Player, Model, Entity ID number, or Entity object.
  • rule - The replication rule to set. Can be a ReplicationRule struct or a function. If nil, removes any existing rule for the target.
    • ReplicationRule : { filterPlayers: {Player}?, filterType: "exclude" | "include" }
    • RuleFn : (entity: Entity, player: Player) -> boolean should return true to replicate the entity to the player, false to not replicate.

items.title: Server.ServerClock
items.text: Manages server time and synchronization with clients.

items.title: ConvertTo(player: Player, clock: number, environment: "Server" | "Client") -> number
items.text:
Converts a timestamp from server time to client time or vice versa for the given player.

  • player - The player to convert the time for.
  • clock - The timestamp to convert.
  • environment - Specify "Server" to convert from client time to server time, or "Client" to convert from server time to client time.

items.title: Push(t: number, value: T)
items.text:
Inserts a snapshot into the buffer.

  • Maintains chronological order
  • Overwrites oldest entries when full

items.title: GetLatest() ‚Üí SnapshotData<T>?
items.text: Returns the most recent snapshot, or nil if empty.

items.title: GetAt(t: number, bypassLock: boolean? ) ‚Üí T?
items.text:
Returns the interpolated value at timestamp t:

  • Interpolates linearly between before and after snapshots
  • Handles wrap-around between 0 and 255 timestamps
  • Returns the closest value if interpolation is not possible
  • bypassLock - If true, ignores any locks on the snapshot buffer when retrieving data. Locks prevent interpolation after certain time.

items.title: Clear() -> ()
items.text: Clears the snapshot buffer.

items.title: Usage Notes
items.text:
• lerp must handle your type T (e.g., CFrame.Lerp, Vector3:Lerp)
  • Used internally by Chrono replication for smooth CFrame interpolation
  • Buffer automatically handles late or out-of-order packets without breaking motion continuity

items.title: ENTITIES_HALF_TICKED : number
items.text: Number of entities that are being half-ticked on the server.

items.title: ENTITIES_FULL_TICKED : number
items.text: Number of entities that are being fully ticked on the server.

items.title: NON_TICKED : number

items.title: Characters
items.text:
The Characters module manages custom player characters across server and client. It handles registration, cloning, storage, and replication of player models, as well as signals for character lifecycle events.

When required, Characters automatically:

  • Creates a container (PlayerCharacterStorage) in parented to the Camera so it doesn't replicate.
  • Creates or waits for a PLAYER_MODEL_CACHE folder in ReplicatedStorage to hold replicated player models.
  • Connects to:
  • Server: Players.PlayerRemoving to clean up models.
  • Client: ChildAdded on PLAYER_MODEL_CACHE to sync characters.

items.title: Characters.GetCharacter(player: Player) ‚Üí Model?
items.text: Returns the current character model registered for the given player, or nil if no character is set.

items.title: Characters.SetCharacter(player: Player, model: Model | string, data: any?)
items.text:
Assigns a character model to the given player.

Parameter Type Description player Player The player whose character is being set. model Model/string The character model instance, or a key referencing a cached model in Config.PLAYER_MODELS. data any? Optional initialization data. Serialized via HttpService:JSONEncode when replicated.
  • If a string key is passed, the model is looked up in Config.PLAYER_MODELS.
  • The model is cloned and parented to PlayerCharacterStorage.
  • If the player already had a character, it is cleaned up and CharacterRemoved is fired.
  • On the server, a clone is inserted into ReplicatedStorage.PLAYER_MODEL_CACHE to sync with the clients.
  • On the client, incoming clones from the cache are registered automatically.

‚ö†Ô∏è Danger If data is provided, ensure it is JSON-serializable.

items.title: Signals
items.text: These fire on both the server and client.

items.title: Characters.CharacterAdded(player: Player, model: Model, data: any)
items.text: Fired when a new character is registered for a player.

items.title: Characters.CharacterRemoved(player: Player, model: Model)
items.text: Fired when a character is removed (e.g. when replaced or on PlayerRemoving).

items.title: Internal Behavior
items.text:
• Models are parented to a hidden Camera in workspace to prevent them from replicating automatically.
  • On the server, each player‚Äôs character is cloned into PLAYER_MODEL_CACHE with their UserId as the name for identification.
  • On the client, clones from PLAYER_MODEL_CACHE are consumed, registered, and removed.
  • When a player leaves, their model is destroyed and CharacterRemoved is fired.

items.title: Usage Example
items.text:
--Enable custom characters, else the character system would not work
require(ReplicatedStorage.Packages.chrono).Config.ENABLE_CUSTOM_CHARACTERS = true
local Characters = require(ReplicatedStorage.Packages.chrono).Characters

--Character lifecycles:
Characters.CharacterAdded:Connect(function(player, model, data)
    print("Character added:", player.Name, model, data)
end)

Characters.CharacterRemoved:Connect(function(player, model)
    print("Character removed:", player.Name, model)
end)

--On the server, set a custom character for Chrono to manage
local player = game.Players.PlayerAdded:Wait()
Characters.SetCharacter(player, "paris", { skidding = true })

--On the client (or server), get the character Chrono is managing
local character = Characters.GetCharacter(game.Players.LocalPlayer)

--I recommend setting up your own custom character system and calling chrono so that they can still be custom replicated, rather than depending on chrono to get your characters. We designed chrono's api to be simple and flexible for exactly that.

items.title: Important Notes on Reset Behavior
items.text:
When using custom characters with the Characters module, the default Roblox reset flow no longer works.

  • If a player resets while using a custom character:
  • The character will not respawn automatically.
  • On the client, the character will remain in a "dead" state.
  • On the server, the character will still be considered alive and will not be replaced.

‚ö†Ô∏è Danger If you enable Config.ENABLE_CUSTOM_CHARACTERS, you must implement your own respawn / reset logic. Roblox‚Äôs built-in reset button will no longer respawn the player automatically.

items.title: RegisterClientNPC(id: number, model: Model, npcType: string?)
items.text:
Registers a client-side NPC for visual interpolation.

  • id ‚Äì Network ID assigned by ChronoServer
  • model ‚Äì NPC model to interpolate
  • npcType (optional) ‚Äì Type key in Config.NPC_TYPES

‚òëÔ∏è tip This is automatically called when registered in NpcRegistry on the server.

items.title: idMap: { [number]: { ... } }
items.text:
Stores the client-side replication state for all entities:

  • snapshot ‚Äì Circular snapshot buffer of CFrames
  • character ‚Äì Linked Model (player or NPC)
  • lastCFrame ‚Äì Last rendered CFrame
  • isNPC ‚Äì Marks NPCs for fixed buffer logic
  • npcType ‚Äì Type used for interpolation config

items.title: playerTickRates: { [number]: number }
items.text: Tracks per-entity tick rates dynamically received from the server.

items.title: BufferTracker
items.text: Reference to the InterpolationBuffer instance used to calculate dynamic interpolation delays.

items.title: GetAllNetworkIds() ‚Üí { number }
items.text: Returns a list of all network IDs currently tracked on the client.

items.title: Notes
items.text:
• Player replication is fully automatic after requiring ChronoClient
  • NPCs must be manually registered with RegisterClientNPC()
  • idMap can be read for debugging or rendering purposes
  • Motion is fully decoupled from Roblox physics buffering

items.title: ReplicationRule
items.text:
Field Type Description filterType "include"/"exclude" The filter type for the replication rule. filterPlayers {Player} the players to include/exclude from the replication rule.

If no rule is found then every Player will receive updates. Otherwise, only the specified players will receive updates.

‚ö†Ô∏è Danger When players leave, players stored in filterPlayers will continue to exist, make sure to clean them up if necessary.

items.title: idMap: { [number]: { ... } }
items.text: Stores the server-side replication state for all entities: - player - The player instance - snapshot ‚Äì Circular snapshot buffer of CFrames - clientLastTick The last timestamp of the client - serverOwned ‚Äì Whether or not the entity is server-owned (player vs NPC) - npcType? - Type of NPC, if any - model ‚Äì Linked model to the id - replicationRule ‚Äì The replication filter the entity is under

items.title: RegisterNPC(model: Model?, npcType: string?) ‚Üí number
items.text:
Registers a new NPC on the server and returns its network ID.

  • model (optional) ‚Äì The NPC‚Äôs physical Model. If omitted, Chrono still tracks the NPC headlessly.
  • npcType (optional) ‚Äì Type key in Config.NPC_TYPES. Defaults to "DEFAULT".

:::danger Use NpcRegistry for physical npcs, or you will need to manually push transforms for movement to be replicated :::

items.title: GetReplicationRule(input: Player | Model | number) ‚Üí ReplicationRule
items.text: Returns the replication rule for a given id, player or model. If no valid id given then return a blank replication rule.

items.title: SetReplicationRule(input: Player | Model | number, rule: ReplicationRule?)
items.text: Sets the replication rule for a given id, player or model. If no rule given then remove the existing rule.

items.title: PushNPCTransform(target: number|Model, cframe: CFrame)
items.text: Pushes a new CFrame snapshot for a server-owned NPC.

items.title: GetLatestCFrame(target: Player | Model | number) ‚Üí CFrame?
items.text:
Returns the latest replicated CFrame for a:

  • Player ‚Äì Pass the Player instance
  • NPC ‚Äì Pass the Model instance
  • Network ID ‚Äì Pass the network ID (number)

items.title: GetLatestTime(target: Player | Model | number) ‚Üí number?
items.text:
Returns the latest replicated time for a:

  • Player ‚Äì Pass the Player instance
  • NPC ‚Äì Pass the Model instance
  • Network ID ‚Äì Pass the network ID (number)

items.title: GetId(target: Player | Model | number) ‚Üí number?
items.text:
Returns the network ID for a:

  • Player ‚Äì Pass the Player instance
  • NPC ‚Äì Pass the Model instance
  • Network ID ‚Äì Pass the network ID (number)

items.title: TogglePlayerReplication(player: Player, on: boolean)
items.text:
Toggles whether Chrono should interpolate the player

  • player ‚Äì Pass the Player instance
  • on ‚Äì Pass a boolean of whether chrono should interpolate

items.title: GetAllNetworkIds() ‚Üí { number }
items.text: Returns a list of all network IDs currently tracked on the server.

items.title: Replicators
items.text:
A table mapping network IDs ‚Üí dummy Models used when Config.DISABLE_DEFAULT_REPLICATION = true.

  • Replicators are visual proxies cloned from StarterPlayer.Replicator and parented to workspace.CurrentCamera.
  • Chrono updates them each frame with BulkMoveTo based on snapshots.
  • They are useful for running queries on the player's characters on the server.
  • You can also access a player's replicator via workspace.Camera[player.Name].

items.title: Notes
items.text:
• ChronoServer drives all server-side replication
  • Players are registered automatically
  • NPCs require manual registration with RegisterNPC()
  • PushNPCTransform does not move the model on the server, only updates snapshots for clients
  • Disabling default replication requires:
  • Config.DISABLE_DEFAULT_REPLICATION = true
  • Optional dummy clones for client visualization

items.title: Config
items.text:
Configs on how chronos works. This can be modified pre-runtime or at runtime before initialization.

‚ö†Ô∏è Danger Remember to modify the config on both the server and client.

‚ö†Ô∏è Danger Only the properties NPC_MODELS and NPC_TYPES may be modified after Chrono.Start() is called, otherwise an error would occur. Other properties must be modified before running Chrono.Start().

items.title: NPC_CONFIG
items.text: Field Type Description TICK_RATE number The tick rate for the npc BUFFER number the buffer time for the npc

items.title: MIN_BUFFER: number
items.text: The minimum buffer time for snapshots.

items.title: MAX_BUFFER: number
items.text: The maximum buffer time for snapshots.

items.title: PROXIMITY: number
items.text: The proximity threshold in studs where TICK_RATE is applied.

items.title: ENABLE_CUSTOM_CHARACTERS: boolean
items.text: If true, allows the use of custom characters in the game. This will disable default roblox replication as well.

items.title: DISABLE_DEFAULT_REPLICATION: boolean
items.text:
If true, disables default roblox replication for players.

‚ö†Ô∏è Danger This will also prevent you from anchoring the primary part of player characters as chrono would be unanchoring locally so they can move as they are anchored on the server to prevent replication.

items.title: SEND_FULL_ROTATION: boolean
items.text:
If true, clients and server will replicate full 3D rotation (as 3√ó mapped u16 values). If false (default), only yaw rotation is sent. This property can be modified during as chrono is running.

üìï Note Full rotation packets are slightly larger (24 bytes) compared to yaw-only packets (20 bytes).

items.title: SHOW_WARNINGS: boolean
items.text: If true, enables the display of common warnings in the console.

items.title: NPC_MODELS: { [string]: Model }
items.text: A mapping of NPC model names to models that will be cloned.

items.title: NPC_TYPES: {[string]: NPC_CONFIG}
items.text: A mapping of NPC types to their configuration.

items.title: PLAYER_MODELS: { [string]: Model }
items.text: A mapping of player model strings to template models. Useful for when ENABLE_CUSTOM_CHARACTERS is true.

items.title: Constructor
items.text:
InterpolationBuffer.new(minBuffer: number, maxBuffer: number, alpha: number) ‚Üí InterpolationBuffer

Creates a new interpolation buffer instance.

Parameter Type Description minBuffer number Minimum interpolation buffer in seconds. maxBuffer number Maximum interpolation buffer in seconds. alpha number Smoothing factor for the moving average latency.

Returns: A table representing the InterpolationBuffer instance with the methods below.

items.title: PlayerLatencies: { [networkId: number]: { averageLatency: number, deviation: number, lastLatency: number? } }
items.text:
A dictionary storing per‚Äëplayer latency data, keyed by networkId. Each entry tracks:

  • averageLatency ‚Üí smoothed round-trip time (RTT)
  • deviation ‚Üí moving deviation (jitter estimate)
  • lastLatency ‚Üí most recent latency sample

items.title: RegisterPacket(networkId: number, serverTime: number, tickRate: number)
items.text:
Registers an incoming packet for latency tracking.

Parameter Type Description networkId number Unique ID representing the player or NPC. serverTime number Timestamp from the server for when the packet was sent. tickRate number Sending tick rate (Hz) for this entity.

items.title: GetBuffer(networkId: number, tickRate: number) ‚Üí number
items.text:
Calculates the current recommended interpolation buffer for a given network ID.

Parameter Type Description networkId number Player or NPC network ID. tickRate number Tick rate (Hz) for this entity.

Returns: A buffer duration in seconds, clamped between minBuffer and maxBuffer.

items.title: Initialization
items.text:
When required, NpcRegistry automatically:

  • Creates a NpcRegistryCamera under workspace to hold client clones.
  • Creates or waits for a NPC_MODEL_CACHE folder in ReplicatedStorage for replicated NPC models.

  • Connects to:

  • Server: RunService.PostSimulation for automatic NPC transform updates.

  • Client: AttributeChanged on NPC_MODEL_CACHE for automatic client registration.

items.title: Npc.RegisterNpcModel(model: Model, npcModelType: string) ‚Üí number
items.text:
Adds the NPC model to the config. Used for creating a copy on the client.

Parameter Type Description model Model The NPC model to register. npcModelType string The type of the NPC model.

:::danger Make sure the model is set on both the server and the client. :::

items.title: Npc.GetModel(id: number) ‚Üí Model?
items.text: Returns the original model for a given NPC ID, if registered.

items.title: Npc.Register(model: Model, npcType: string?, modelType: string?, automaticUpdate: boolean?,initData:any?) ‚Üí number
items.text:
Registers an NPC on the server.

Parameter Type Description model Model The NPC model to register. npcType string? Optional NPC type, defaults to "DEFAULT". modelType string? Optional model type, if defined in config then that will use that as the model other wise model:clone() will be used. automaticUpdate boolean? If true, the server will automatically replicate cframe changes. initData any? Optional data to be passed along during initialization. Sent to Npc.NpcAdded

Returns: The id for the registered NPC.

‚ö†Ô∏è Danger If initData is given, the data will be serialized using HttpService:JSONEncode(). Be aware of what can and cannot be serialized.

items.title: Npc.UnRegister(idOrModel: number | Model) ‚Üí Model
items.text:
Unregisters an NPC from the server and cleans up its cache.

Parameter Type Description idOrModel number | Model NPC ID or the registered model.

Returns: The original NPC Model.

items.title: Signals
items.text:
These will fired on both the server and client.

‚ö†Ô∏è Danger These will only fire if the entity is registered via NpcRegistry. Manual Registration using ChronoServer.RegisterNPC will not trigger these signals.

items.title: Npc.NpcAdded
items.text:
Fired when a new NPC is added.

Parameter Type Description npcId number The ID of the added NPC. model Model The model of the added NPC. data any The initialization data.

items.title: Npc.NpcRemoved
items.text:
Fired when an NPC is removed.

Parameter Type Description npcId number The ID of the removed NPC. model Model The model of the removed NPC.

items.title: Client Behavior
items.text:
On the client, NpcRegistry:

  1. Clones each NPC into workspace.NpcRegistryCamera for rendering.
  2. Registers the clone with ClientReplicate for smooth interpolation.
  3. Destroys the clone and unregisters automatically when the NPC is removed.

:::danger Animations are non replicated from server to client. If you want NPC animations to be visible, you must play them on the clients. This is also idiomatic as it optimizes roblox transforms. :::

items.title: Usage Example
items.text:
local NpcRegistry = require(ReplicatedStorage.Packages.chrono).NpcRegistry

NpcRegistry.NpcAdded:Connect(function(npcId, model, data)
    print("NPC added:", npcId, model, data)
end)

NpcRegistry.NpcRemoved:Connect(function(npcId, model)
    print("NPC removed:", npcId, model)
end)

--Register npc on server
local npcModel = workspace:WaitForChild("Goblin")
NpcRegistry.Register(npcModel, "DEFAULT", nil, true, { EyeColor = "Green" })

--Change cframe
npcModel:PivotTo(CFrame.new(Vector3.new(20, 5, -20)))

--Unregister for cleanup
NpcRegistry.UnRegister(npcModel)

items.title: RenderCache.Init(dependencies)
items.text:
Initializes the module.

Parameter Type Description playerTickRates { [number]: number } Map of network IDs to tick rates. bufferTracker InterpolationBuffer Reference to an interpolation buffer tracker.

items.title: RenderCache.GetBuffer(id: number) ‚Üí number
items.text:
Returns the current interpolation buffer for the given network ID.

  • NPCs use the fixed buffer from Config.NPC_TYPES
  • Players use the dynamic buffer calculated by InterpolationBuffer

items.title: RenderCache.OnSnapshotUpdate(snapshot: { [number]: number })
items.text:
Updates internal timing whenever a new snapshot of server timestamps is received.

  • Stores the last known server tick for each entity
  • Prepares for calculating the next render timestamp

items.title: RenderCache.Update(deltaTime: number)
items.text:
Advances target render times per entity.

  • Predicts server time based on last tick and delta
  • Smooths timing errors using drift correction
  • Snaps to server time if error exceeds 0.1s

items.title: RenderCache.GetTargetRenderTime(id: number) ‚Üí number
items.text: Returns the target render timestamp for a given entity. If no render time exists yet, returns 0 and emits a warning.

items.title: RenderCache.GetEstimatedServerTime(id: number) ‚Üí number
items.text: Estimates the current server time for an entity. Uses the last known tick plus local elapsed time.

items.title: RenderCache.Add(id: number, isNPC: boolean?, npcType: string?)
items.text:
Registers a new player or NPC in the cache.

  • Initializes timing data
  • NPCs are flagged and associated with a type if provided

items.title: RenderCache.Remove(id: number)
items.text: Removes an entity from the cache and clears all timing information.

items.title: SnapshotData<T>
items.text: Field Type Description t number The snapshot timestamp value T The stored value

items.title: Snapshot<T>
items.text:
A snapshot buffer with indexing and interpolation.

Field / Method Type Description cache { SnapshotData<T> } Internal buffer lerp(a: T, b: T, alpha: number) (T, T, number) -> T Linear interpolation function for type T Push(t, value) (self, number, T) -> () Inserts a snapshot at timestamp t GetLatest() (self) -> SnapshotData<T>? Returns the most recent snapshot GetAt(t) (self, number) -> T? Returns an interpolated value at time t

items.title: Push(t: number, value: T)
items.text:
Inserts a snapshot into the buffer.

  • Maintains chronological order
  • Overwrites oldest entries when full

items.title: GetLatest() ‚Üí SnapshotData<T>?
items.text: Returns the most recent snapshot, or nil if empty.

items.title: GetAt(t: number) ‚Üí T?
items.text:
Returns the interpolated value at timestamp t:

  • Interpolates linearly between before and after snapshots
  • Handles wrap-around between 0 and 255 timestamps
  • Returns the closest value if interpolation is not possible

items.title: Usage Notes
items.text:
• lerp must handle your type T (e.g., CFrame.Lerp, Vector3:Lerp)
  • Used internally by Chrono replication for smooth CFrame interpolation
  • Buffer automatically handles late or out-of-order packets without breaking motion continuity
